sentences.en: Getting a visa isn't as simple as you might suppose.
sentences.cn: 办签证不像你想的那么容易。

sentences.en: He applies to the consul for a visa.
He first entered Britain on a six-month visa, and was given a further extension of six months.
sentences.cn: 他最初持6个月的签证进入英国，后来又获得6个月的续签。

sentences.en: He has thinked they can give him the visa.
sentences.cn: 我安排汤姆同他们见面.

sentences.en: I was still in New York, trying to get a visa to visit Russia.
sentences.cn: 我仍在纽约，正在办理去俄罗斯的签证。

sentences.en: I've given up trying to get a visa; there is too much red tape involved.
sentences.cn: 我不想再去搞签证了, 繁文缛节太多.

sentences.en: Smedley went to London, intending to wait there for a visa.
sentences.cn: 史沫特莱前往伦敦, 准备在那里等待签证.

sentences.en: The chief protagonists in the row are Visa and Mastercard, the world's leading credit card brands.
sentences.cn: 这场纠纷的主角是世界两大信用卡品牌——维萨和万事达。

sentences.en: the lengthy process of obtaining a visa

sentences.cn: 他们居留超过了签证期限。

sentences.en: What type of visa have you got?
When applying for a visa state simply and clearly the reasons why you need it.
sentences.cn: 申请签证时，要简单明了地说明申请理由。

sentences.en: You'll have to get a passport, and you'll also need a visa.
sentences.cn: 你必须申办护照, 同时还需要有签证.

trans.tran_en: an official mark put on your passport that gives you permission to temporarily enter or leave a foreign country
